action.action-desc: Ms. Meng introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to treat infant formula as adulterated if its use-by date has passed.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Infant Formula Protection Act of 2015.

subsection.text: Section 412(a) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 350a(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (3), by striking the period at the end and inserting , or; and
by adding at the end the following:
such infant formula’s use-by date, as specified in the formula’s labeling in accordance with section 107.20 of title 21, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations) has passed.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) applies beginning on the date that is 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act.
